meanings.definition: The ability of an organism to cause disease.
meanings.sent1: The pathogenicity of the virus led to widespread illness in the community.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the pathogenicity of bacteria to understand how infections spread.
meanings.sent3: The pathogenicity of the bacteria was so strong, even the strongest antibiotics couldn't stop it.
meanings.sent4: The pathogenicity of the virus spread through the population like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The pathogenicity of the fungus was so potent, it wiped out entire crops.

meanings.definition: The state or quality of being pathogenic.
meanings.sent1: The pathogenicity of the disease was evident in the rapid spread among the population.
meanings.sent2: Doctors were concerned about the pathogenicity of the new strain of bacteria.
meanings.sent3: The pathogenicity of the virus seemed almost magical in how quickly it affected people.
meanings.sent4: The pathogenicity of the parasite was like a silent invader in the body.
meanings.sent5: The pathogenicity of the pathogen was so high, it caused alarm among health officials.
